lens.book_chapters: Part 1: The Category King Economy (Chapters 1-2) â€” Creation Wins, Category Is the New Strategy

reinforcements.similarity: Both prioritize explicit trust signaling before deeper commitment actions.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Design-stack trust credential patterns focus on proof ordering; this reverse-benchmark run adds competitor-gap evidence that users still ask 'is this legit?' before first contact.
reinforcements.confidence_boost: Inside-out and outside-in both identify legitimacy proof as a first-order need.

reinforcements.similarity: Both turn proposal chaos into explicit negotiation states with visible next action.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Design-stack calls show confusion at asynchronous commitment moments; this run adds Roomster category evidence that manual chat handoffs are structural, not incidental.
reinforcements.confidence_boost: Multiple runs point to the same commitment-cliff pattern with different source materials.

reinforcements.similarity: Both bring real-time availability state into the core guest decision path.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Existing guest pattern calls for in-flow availability clarity; this run contributes transcript-backed cross-platform sync failure evidence and reschedule breakdowns.
reinforcements.confidence_boost: The same availability pain appears in both active guest behavior and competitor benchmark analysis.

reinforcements.similarity: Both use lightweight reflection prompts to preserve memory and improve future decision quality.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Prior reverse-benchmark work proposed reflection prompts; this run ties them to category-level retention weakness and repeat-from-scratch user behavior.
reinforcements.confidence_boost: Independent reverse-benchmark runs converge on post-stay memory loops as a durable gap.

reinforcements.similarity: Both strengthen active-stay lifecycle support instead of treating match completion as the product endpoint.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Design-stack identifies Stays Manager as behavioral center of gravity; this run adds Play Bigger evidence that lifecycle ownership is the category moat.
reinforcements.confidence_boost: Cross-process convergence increases confidence that lifecycle operations are strategic, not feature-level.

extensions.gap_filled: Pre-contact legitimacy chain that explicitly includes unresolved unknowns as first-class trust data.
extensions.confidence_note: Moderate-high confidence from direct transcript language about scams and legitimacy checks.

extensions.gap_filled: Auditable commitment-state rail with ownership and deadline clarity before money movement.
extensions.confidence_note: Moderate-high confidence; operational/legal details require design-stack validation of implementation constraints.

extensions.gap_filled: Unified availability truth timeline across search, negotiation, and rescheduling.
extensions.confidence_note: Moderate confidence; concept is validated but integration feasibility should be tested.

cross_process_insights.insight: Trust sequencing is two-step: legitimacy evidence before chat, then commitment state clarity before payment.
cross_process_insights.implication: Split Lease should treat trust as a staged architecture, not a single verification badge.

cross_process_insights.insight: Availability reliability and negotiation reliability are one system problem, not separate feature tracks.
cross_process_insights.implication: Date certainty must stay synchronized from listing card through acceptance and later reschedule states.

cross_process_insights.insight: Retention quality improves when active-stay signals feed into future default decisions.
cross_process_insights.implication: Measure retention by improved next-cycle decision quality, not only return rate.

token_compliance.recommendation: Use canonical style-guide palette and formal token aliases before production implementation; avoid ad hoc token naming in shipped components.

next_run_recommendations.recommendation: Run a guest-focused design-stack pass on first-contact legitimacy and commitment sequencing with direct usability validation.
next_run_recommendations.reason: This run produced strong outside-in trust signals that now need direct interaction validation with guests and hosts.

next_run_recommendations.recommendation: Benchmark one trust-forward competitor and one pure lead-funnel competitor on reschedule reliability and post-stay memory loops.
next_run_recommendations.reason: Comparative evidence will sharpen which reliability and retention mechanisms are truly category-defining.
